intro: Psoralea tetragonoloba, commonly known as the four-angled psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being oval-shaped and slightly hairy. Psoralea tetragonoloba is also notable for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
